intro: Malachra ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf malachra, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate, waxy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in marshy areas along rivers and lakes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and wetland restoration projects.
